subject: From the desk of; Mostafa G
body:
From the desk of; Mostafa Golam
Manager, Brew-Master Securities Inc.
Address: Cobian's Pl, 1607 PR-25 Bldg.
Suite 126, San Juan, 00909, Puerto Rico
Telephone No: +1 787 3957683
Email: 
mstgolam53@gmail.com
Dear Sir / Madam,
My heart is deeply filled with pains and tears allover my face because
I lost my beloved wife last month, I suffered so much with my beloved
children at COVID-19 Quarantine | CDC after the death of my wife, the
miserable Quarantine ended 2-days ago while my children remain in
shock of isolation trauma and agony of their mother's death (my late
wife).
I have decided to relocate with my beloved children for better life,
unfortunately I don't have money because my salary hardly take care of
my beloved family. As the Manager of Brew-Master Securities Inc.,
there is unclaimed US$989,600.00 belonged to deceased without
successor. I deemed it necessary to execute this DEAL urgently with
you, and my benefit will be enough to relocate my beloved family.
I shall file a claim presenting you as successor to deceased depositor
of US$989,600.00 and the funds will be released to you within 5-hours
of filing the claim today. Please respond with your complete details
to file successor's claim in your favor vehemently. My nationality is
Bangladesh (I'm Bangalees) residing in Puerto Rico. I have whatsapp
number should you wish to chat, thanks in great anticipation of your
considerably reply showing humane kindness to my traumatized family.
Respectfully yours,
Mr Mostafa MD Golam
Manager, Brew-Master Securities Inc.
Address: Cobian's Pl, 1607 PR-25 Bldg.
Suite 126, San Juan, 00909, Puerto Rico
Telephone No: +1 787 3957683
Email: 
mstgolam53@gmail.com

subject: Re:    From the desk of; Mostafa G
body:
Dear Mr. Mostafa MD Golam,

I'm deeply sorry to hear about your loss and the difficult situation you and your children are currently facing. I understand that this must be a very challenging time for you all.

Regarding the unclaimed funds, I would like to know more details about this process. How can I be presented as the successor to the deceased depositor? What kind of legal implications does this have?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Rita
